dublin_core.dcvalue: AU Washington College of Law’s Program on Information Justice and Intellectual Property (PIJIP) and the UCT Faculty of Law’s Intellectual Property Unit (IP Unit)

A survey of filmmakers to assess their practices and perceptions. In this stage.survey sought evidence of filmmakers’ perceptions and practices with regard to the use of copyrighted material in their films. Semi-structured interviews were conducted with more than 40 experienced filmmakers, supplementedby a two-day focus group meeting with dozens of additional filmmakers.
A series of workshops with filmmakers aimed at co-generating solutions for the copyright problems identified in the survey.
